question: Question_02_(a)
statement:
\emph{\textbf{Short answer question.} Simplify your answer to the best
possible. Show in detail how you arrive at your answer (work will be
considered for this problem).}

Use the integral comparison test to show that

\[\int_1^\infty \frac{e^{-x}}{2x-1}\,dx\] converges.
sols:
On the interval $[1,\infty)$ we have that 2\emph{x}-1 $\geq$ 1 and so

\[\frac{e^{-x}}{2x-1} \leq e^{-x}\] for all \emph{x} $\geq$ 1. Therefore

\[\int_1^\infty \frac{e^{-x}}{2x-1}\,dx \leq \int_1^\infty e^{-x}\,dx\]

by the integral comparison test. Since the latter integral

\[\int_1^\infty e^{-x}\,dx\] converges (see lecture notes or direct
calculation), the former integral also converges, by the integral
comparison test.
